title: How to get 90 percent or above in class 10 in the CBSE - Quora
tags: Central Board of Secondary Education, India

response.answer_text: So, you are going to appear for your 10th board exams this year and may be wondering if it is possible to score 99% in your 10th class examination. Well, I would like to say you, “Yes, it is possible”. It is not easy, but can be done, if you really want to do it. People might ask what is so special about 99% marks. It is just that anyone can score 90%. That is not at all difficult. Even a student with average intelligence, who studies hard can score 90%. But 99% marks mean that you have mastered the complete syllabus. There is no one better than you. You are the champion of champions. Well, first of all remember that there is nothing that you cannot achieve. It might be a 99% in your board exams or anything else in your life, everything is possible, if you truly want to achieve it. All it takes is a lot of hard work and perseverance. Secondly, remember that there is no shortcut to success and you must try harder to make it right. Just be positive and focus on to your goal. Important points to get 99% marks in your 10th Exams Don’t count hours, study till you understand a topic completely. As soon as you understand something, write it down in your own language to make your own notes.Important thing is the planning. To make sure that you do not lose your track in between, you must have a solid plan of study. Make a plan in the very beginning and follow it for the complete year. Start off from the topics that you don’t have much confidence on. These topics are the ones, which are difficult for you to understand, to grasp and to remember. Study those topics first, keep two books with you (one rough and the other for revising it during exam). Make your own notes for the difficult topics first.The next thing is the study pattern. If you really want to achieve that 99% target, you must love your books. Yes, you must be completely in love with them. Do not take study as a burden, but try to like it. Your study pattern plays a big role. Try to make your study interesting.Make a schedule (time table), which would eventually help you in tracking your completion everyday.Do not compromise with your health.Give enough time for other important things that you like to do like games, music, food and friends.Do not worry even if you cannot complete the syllabus in first 6 months, but make sure that you complete it twice or thrice before the exam.Before going to sleep at night, revise everything that you have studied on that day.There is no shortcut or trick to score above 90.Hard work and dedication is all it takes.Preparation Tips for Subjects Class 10 Science The CBSE Class 10 Science mainly focuses on the following areas – Chemistry, Physics and Biology. Those students who wish pursue the science stream in class XI are advised to strictly focus on all these three areas as this will clear their foundations. The complete list of formulae, experiments and derivations should be kept handy.It’s a strict no-no to miss the science laboratory lectures and classes. Utilise the science laboratory as much as you can for every single experiment.The NCERT books are to be followed thoroughly to score well in Science. Almost the whole question paper revolves around the concepts that are given in the NCERT book.Some science formulas have certain rules that you strictly need to follow and use it correctly. For example, to use the quadratic formula; you must first change the equation to the standard quadratic form.PHYSICS-Get a grip on the fundamental concepts of the subject. A major part of the exam contains direct formulae- and theorem-based questions. Therefore, revise them thoroughly to solve questions accurately. Use the formulae and theorems extensively in solving various problems from last years’ papers and model papers.CHEMISTRY-The good news is this is a high-scoring subject, and also requires lesser time for preparation. Speed and accuracy in solving different problems can be acquired through in-depth study of the subject and extensive practice. Study the name reactions; make charts of formulae along with names and revise them as and when possible.BIOLOGY-As the subject includes lots of diagrams, give special attention to important diagrams and their theory. Make sure you remember the important terms and their respective functions. Biology involves learning and memorising difficult terminology. Write such terms repeatedly so as to get acquainted with them. Get thorough with the important definitions as the subject is mostly theory.Class 10 Math The CBSE Class 10 Class 10th mathematics focuses on the basic geometry, trigonometry and the concept of numbers. The subject helps to build a basic aptitude and concepts that would be beneficial for the students who wish to appear for the aptitude based tests in future. The class 10 Maths formulas are otherwise very general, but sometimes it is seen in the previous question papers that the questions are asked from the middle of such numerical which you have to identify it.The concepts/formulas sheet should be kept handy.You should know the usage of all the Maths formulas.If you really want to score an A1 in math exam, then it is really important to completely be in synch with your NCERT book. Almost the whole questions paper comprises of the concepts and formulas that are given in the NCERT book.If you are solving a problem based question, it is advisable to read the problem again and again to get the exact idea of what you’re being asked to solve.Write down in a rough paper, exact what it is given in the question paper and what you are asked to find. Then in a systematic way, try and find what is asked to you.Once the revision is done, start solving the sample papers, unsolved papers and practice papers within the given set of time.Class 10 Social Studies Although social science may seem dull, use study tools to make it fun. Flash cards, timelines, colorful charts and funny mnemonics can help you study in addition to textbook and notes reading. In 10th class either your social sciences studies are beginning or ending. Read the course once without trying to remember it, just read like you would read the newspaper or novel and try to understand it.Give priority for your subjects and topics according to marks weight-age and easy and difficult chapters and use this list to create a practical study schedule.Take notes for specific points you feel are important and you are likely to forget, in addition to school notes.Create a chart with important dates, flip through it often and you will find that you are able to easily remember the dates.Study subject-wise rather than from all topics combined; they were separated for a reason.Use flash cards for definitions and also for various history events; flash cards help for fun and quick revision.Practice map work by tracing the important locations you want to remember, then try locating on a blank mapUnderstand economics and political science, its better than to try to memorize.Solve previous year papers/ sample papers to practice writing within word limits.Class 10 English Unseen passage/note making: This is an extremely scoring section and needs the least amount of effort comparatively. Read the passage carefully and you will be able to find the links to answer the questions.Writing skills: Follow formats religiously. Majority of the questions in this section are for 10 marks, divided into 3 marks for format, 4 for content and 3 for fluency/accuracy of English as far as I remember. Look at sample letters, articles from reference books to improve thinking skills and get an idea of presentation. The board examiners would much rather prefer an exhaustive article with lots of ideas and inputs by the student than just repetitive arguments in flowery language.Grammar: Practice, practice, practice. Brush up basic rules and attempt as many questions as possible and learn from the mistakes you make.Literature: Read all the chapters very thoroughly. Specially for poems, write in your book or a separate notepad all that your teacher explains. Having said that, you should also realise that understanding the chapter is not enough as you will be expected to write 7-10 mark answers in the exam. Keeping this in mind, try to attempt past year papers and questions from other reference material and try to frame long answers. Each of these long answers should have an introduction, body and conclusion. Aim for about 150-200 words spread across 3-4 paragraphs.Class 10 Hindi It is fairly easy to score 90+ in this paper 12th boards. But to score in late 90s, you need to study the NCERT textbooks really well. They are extremely useful.Get a question bank cum guide (Golden is one of them) and practice questions.Solve past year papers (Arihant, Oswal or any of the available sources), check against the solutions provided. In fact, a lot many times questions are just repeated in exams.This is it. These 3 simple things will equip you to score 95+ in the paper.Keep your mind fresh and never falter. Don't get stressed too much my friend. At the end you too will realise that was it really a thing of being stressed !. If I honestly make a true commitment about how I studied and managed then 101% you won't believe me. I enjoyed my 10th to the fullest I could do in the starting months. I was a backbencher and mainly depended upon tution (maths and science). I focused on ncert mainly and practiced sample papers. I started studied after September only. But after September, I studied day and night regularly. I just slept 4–5 hrs a day and was totally determined towards my boards. the last few months mainly jan-feb is the main and the most imp time for hardwork. Dont just try to take it lightly. That's the only time for self practice and to realise how much you are under water…… Hope my words help. Best wishes….☺ Good luck for your results. Hope you score even above 95%

With the right amount of dedication, time management and presentation, every answer script marks can turn out to be a high score. So keep working hard for your ambitions and follow these tips given below to score good marks in your exams. “Self-belief and hard work will always earn you success”. Tips for preparation in 10th board exams: Make a study PlannerMake your study planner and include every subjects don’t leave anyone. For a day give some hours to particular subjects, subjects which you finds are hard schedule on top in the early morning. Then scoring and one interesting subject keep side for day time while you get bored of study pick your interesting subject and your time will not waste just looking at book. Don’t forget to take a break in between. Revision is important thing, learn today and revise tomorrow. This key will make you succeed and help you to score good in board exam. Manage your time effectively“if you didn’t care for time, time will never give you a chance to care for the thing you needed” That’s simple time is one of the most dangerous thing, you should take care of. Try studying 4 or 5 hours daily. Make a chart for your daily routine and give maximum time to your study. It will help you reduce anxiety and focus on studying. Keep Up with the SyllabusUnderstanding your portions and the weightage attached to different sections. this will help you in deciding how much time to dedicate to each section. For example, if you know that there will be just a 5 marks question from a particular section, you do not have to dedicate a week practicing those sums. Subject Wise Preparation Tips: 1. Social Science Create a chart with important dates, flip through it often and you will find that you are able to easily remember the dates.Along with dates, names of people will also be present in abundance, when it comes to History. Names of Freedom Fighters, Rulers etc will be present in large numbers.When it comes to Geography topic, marking stuff on maps is a surprise question that may be asked in 10th Board Examination. Map marking can’t be mastered just by looking and going through maps! You will have to plot yourself the asked locations on the map and practice it!While learning long answers, try to form a link between the different events. Try to relate the concepts by asking yourself questions like what happened after this and why.Try to memorize the long answers in the form of points instead of paragraphs.Always attempt the short questions first. The lengthy questions should be attended at the end.2. Maths Must refer previous year board exam papers, you will easily understand the level of questions which can be asked in board exams.NCERT is the best book for CBSE 10th maths. Each and every concept is explained in simple language and supported with examples. All the solved and unsolved questions in NCERT books are the most important questions for Class 10 Maths exam paper.After thoroughly going with NCERT started doing R. D SHARMA. tried to complete all the examples of R. D. SHARMA for better practice of concepts. RD Sharma is vast book with variety of questions.Maintain a separate register for formulae, theories and methods.Having a clear understanding about your syllabus and the weightage to various sections will definitely help you to decide how much time you should dedicate to each section.Figures and graphs can help you to score more marks if you make them with a little concentration.3. English: Unseen passage/note making: This section is quite scoring and needs the least amount of effort comparatively.Reading the newspaper, topics from philosophy and even science fiction can help you improve your English language knowledge and can help you prepare for the board exam.Writing skills: Stick to formats strictly. Most of the questions on this subject are for 10 marks, divided into 3 marks for the format.Practice formal letters, applications and report speeches and understand the format properly.Grammar: Follow a good grammar book and know the basic rules.Literature: where you will probably be asked analytical questions as well as content questions, you must have time to familiarize yourself with some of the complexities of your material.4. Science a. Physics Go through NCERT bookPracticing the numerical questions and revising the concepts.Physics has several questions based on theorem and direct formulas which can be memorized by revising thoroughly.You must get a grip on the fundamental concepts of the subject.b. Chemistry It is always advised to go through the derivations, SCC, FCC, BCC etc. These are some of the very important portions of the board exams.Students can also practice as many organic reactions as they can to have the thorough idea of the subject.Study the name reactions; make charts of formulae along with names and revise them as and when possible.After you finish your syllabus, revise as many times as possiblec. Biology This subject includes a lot of diagrams, so it’s important to give special attention to diagrams and their theory.Ensure that important terms and their respective functions are remembered.Biology has a lot of learning and memorization of difficult terminology.Get meticulous with the key definitions as the subject is mostly theory.It is recommended to know about the weightage of each science to score better in board exam. for this use “Oye Exams” app where you can see chapter wise weighted analysis of each subject.5. Hindi The poetries and the meaning of there are to be memorized along with the important chapters and the questions arising from it.Solve previous years papers and cross-check with the solutions provided. In fact, most of the times, questions are just repeated in exams.Be clear about the grammatical rules related to topics prescribed in your syllabus. Practice grammar questions as much as you can.Learn the format for essay and letter writing and practice descriptive questions as much as you can.I also have a suggestion of an application Oye Exams Available at Google Play Store can help you to make your Board exam easy. They provide: Previous 12 years solved Question papers (with Original Paper copy).Chapter-wise Question bankGraphical weightage analysis of each subject.Yearly marking Trend analysis for each chapter.Syllabus of each subject.All Subjects Textbooks (eg. NCERT) and their SolutionsVideo lessons by expert teachers.Important QuestionsBest of luck

I appeared for X Board exams last year and got 95% so I think I am eligible to answer this question. Scoring 90% is not at all difficult. You just need to practice subjective questions. MATHS: For maths I recommend practicing solved examples from RD Sharma. You will find every type of question with detailed solutions. You can also solve OSWAL Sample paper for a quick self analysis.SCIENCE: Read NCERT again and again. Learn all the chemical equations (Esterification and Soap ones are important). Again you can solve OSWAL Sample Papers for Science also. No other book is required.SOCIAL SCIENCE: Just read NCERT, no other book is required. You should make notes of important chapters so that you can revise the vast syllabus easily before exams. The notes should not contain long answers but rather bullet points and Key words. Use different colours to mark easy, medium and difficult topics.ENGLISH: Scoring good in English is very easy if you know what to do.Firstly begin your Letter to Editor with “I am ABC from XYZ institute. I am an ardent reader of your Newspaper. Through the esteemed columns of your prestigious publication, I would like to draw the attention of concerned Authorities and Citizens towards… _(The Issue)_”The story should always have a Title and a Moral.The Long answers should have Three parts: The introduction, the content and an ending.Use difficult words in Article Writing. Using words like “Aesthetic, Magnificent, Utopia, Diastopia” etc help to get a good impression and fetch extra marks. Don't forget the title (1 mark).Hope this answer helps. ALL THE BEST!!

Well firstly congratulations , you are on the right path because this question shows your desire to perform exceptionally in your board exam . I gave my board exam last year and scored 98.4 percentage in boards luckily , so since I got experience last year I can give you some suggestions that may help you too score 90 percent and even higher than it. 1 The most important and the very basic thing is that don’t ignore ncert because it is must. Although we know it very well but many times we tend to forget it and start rushing towards lots of extra sources like guides or refresher. 2. Give equal preference to every subject whether it is english , hindi or social science. As most of the time we invest studying maths and science and ignore these subjects .Remeber all the subjects carry equal weightage and ultimately these are the subjects which will boost your percentage. 3. Be consistent - It does not matter that how many hours you are devoting for study because this is subjective for everyone but do study daily . At least invest 2 hours daily . 4. Try practicing as many previous year question papers as possible becuse then you get acquainted with the pattern and structure of the questions being asked. 5. Revision is the key so one thing you can do is whatever stuff you have studied whole week , give practice test from all those topics on sunday. You may ask your parents or sibling to make a practice test paper for you from all those topics you have covered in a week. This way you could analyse your performance and do all the improvement required . So book your weekend for revision and enjoyment!! 6. Learn how to attempt paper- You should know the correct way of attempting paper because paper presentation also help you to gain some extra marks , for this you may refer to you tube because many youtubers have covered this topic in detail. And whenever you solve sample paper set the timer and try to cover it in 2 hours 30 minute so that you can easily complete your board paper and also left with sometime to recheck it. Hope it helps !! And wish you all the best , You will rock it.

Everyone has their own different strategy but I think this one might help you. Pay attention to the lectures at class. Careful listening helps one a lot in learning. If you have any doubt ask your teacher.Plan your strategy in advance Set everyday goals for yourself. Need not to be something big like finishing whole chapter in one day but learning some important topics and terminologies.Never leave your studies for tomorrow. I can relate from my experience procrastinating costs a lot. So start early and be diligent from start.Make a realistic timetable not an idealistic one. It matters a lot how you manage your time and what is your everyday schedule.Make a timetable that you are convenient with and is really beneficial for your studies. If you make a timetable you cannot adjust with that ultimately you will be lenient towards your study.Make study interesting by learning the way you remember and understand. You can make charts, draw diagrams etc. If you are a visual learner than you will be able to learn better through educational animations and videos.After learning each chapter note the important points and make mind maps.Write concise and smart. Only highlight the important and scoring points. If you try to write more in belief that you will score more you will just mismanage your time in exam.And as the others mentioned some good books study them.Solve previous year question papers and take a lot of mock tests.Don’t be over worried about your marks. The knowledge you earn is more worth than what you score.Don’t be nervous in the exam hall and take care of yourself . At last I convey my best wishes for you.

It’s early months of the session and my sister, being in same class often ask me the same question. I’ve got just one less than a perfect CGPA in 10th, so I’m quite illegible to answer this. Quality over Quantity- I’m a messed up student when it comes to following studying schedules and time tables. But, still I manage to cover an entire subject in a week or so. Devoting less time but with all focus and devotion can fetch you good marks.Be attentive in Classroom- So, it’s perfectly fine if you’re not regular at studies, you’re not opening your books everyday at home. But, pay full attention in classroom. This not only gives you an idea about a topic but helps you to retain well in the boards preparation.Presentation matters- Okay so, I’ve experienced this one. Presentation do matters, it’s not only about the content. While writing an answer you must value the time of a reader as well. Answers should be apt and to the point.To make your answer sheet look more interesting you can use black and blue pen for writing. Moreover, I always try to use different method of presentation in each of my answer. For instance, making flow charts, tabular forms, use of boxes, making diagrams with your own interpretation. It just looks amazing! I have few of my 11th and 12th answer sheets in which I’ve used similar method and it does fetch you good marks. Revisions- Is there any single definition or formula you forget each and every single time? Then, revision is the key for you. Time to time just revise over and over. For many of you, 10th would be first time when you’re getting the whole book for exam if I’’m not wrong. To avoid last minute mugging up and confusions take revisions over and over. Maintain a small notepad for formulas, make placards for new words in English (Vocabulary), make notes if needed and read them, solve map questions and just glance at them everyday. READING last year’s question papers- Yes, you read that right, at least READ the question papers, solving them is up to you. I know it’s difficult to solve them in limited time and that so when you have syllabus lagging. If your preparation is done, then just go through the question papers to have an idea about what type of questions come in exam. But, for math you do need to practice a lot apart from NCERTs if aiming for full marks.Balance is important- Give enough time for other important things that you like to do like games,movies, music, food and friends. Don’t stress yourself too much. Keep your mind fresh and never falter.Don’t risk your 300/50% marks- In order to score good in math and science, don’t forget language subjects (English & 2 other languages). They do carry marks. Practice writing skills.Pre-Boards are important- The biggest mistake one can do is not taking pre-boards seriously. They help you to gear up for final board exams and take necessary steps to start working on weak areas without feeling stressed.If you want to consult a guide- Bhavya Bansal's answer to What are best reference book for class 10?Stick to the NCERT- Yes, yes, CBSE loves ncert! There’s nothing more to explain about it! :DAll the best, Thanks for reading!

When one student enters Grade 10,he suddenly gets a lot of pressure from his/her parents,teachers,http://friends.So,that child gets baffled/perplexed from all that.so/,in this text,I am just gonna tell that how one can score good marks in Grade 10 1.Don’t Procrastinate-Procastination is something,which everyone does,while being know that he/she shouldn’t procrastinate,if you think that you ll be able to score more than 90%,by just studying the last month,then it’s not really possible,if you have that kind of attitude,then you won’t even able to score more than 85%,Just start from today,or atleast Start from tomorrow. 2.Listen everything to your teacher-Listening to your teacher while a lecture is something which will 100% help you to score more than 90% in Grade X examinations.Make notes,of each and everything which is being taught by the teacher. 3.Take full advantage of Internet-This was something which went superbly good for me,I wasn’t actually able to focus in each and every lesson(which is very important),and I used to procrastinate a http://lot.So,due to that,I was only able to score 78% in November examinations(held in my school,it may or may not be held in your school).So,from that point onwards,I made up my mind that I need to score more than 90% in the finals,so I was actually just watching one of the videos on YouTube,and then,I watched an Ad,which was about a channel which taught for free,which was Vedantu,just saw one the lectures from vedantu,and I was just fascinated by the quality of education,that they were providing for free,and I thought that I need to study from Vedantu from then onwards.They used to teach eveyday,and during the preboard and board examinations,they launched a series which was SPRINT X,in which,one could do one of the most important questions in just 30 minutes 4.Solve sample papers-This point is one of the most important point in this text,Sample Papers help the students by just providing exam-like feel,with the most important questions. 5.Buy a Question Bank and Solve it-This point is optional for the students,but it helped me a lot,as it told me the questions which were very important.

For scoring 90% in class 10 board exams you should be comfortable in solving all types questions, conceptual, direct as well as HOTS. And also be prepared for indirect questions. Golden Rule- Have NCERT on your fingertips Then move to RS Aggarwal and RD Sharma. They will ensure you are well prepared for conceptual and HOTS, you can also refer to PK Garg. After references practice solving previous years question papers and CBSE sample papers. Solving previous years question papers and sample papers will help you work on your speed and help you identify the type of questions that take a long time for you to solve. Any doubts that may arise while solving the exercises/ sample papers/ previous years question papers can be solved by Doubtnut. Here you can easily find solution to any question, all you have to do is upload the photo of your question.  You can also get your doubts solved on WhatsApp directly on the number: 8400 400 400  All you have to do is take a picture of your question and send it on the above mentioned number, answer will be provided to you by Doubtnut instantly. This service is absolutely free. Good Luck!

CBSE Board Exam: Tips and Tricks to score 90% marks in Class 10 and 12 Board Exams in 100 Days CBSE has not declared the date sheet for 10th and 12th board exam so far. It is expected that CBSE board exams 2018 will start from 1st week of March 2018. Class 10th and 12 students have nearly 100 days (including exam period) for their preparation. Keeping in mind the pressure on board students, experts at Moducation are providing the best study plan for class 10th and 12th board exams. With this plan students can utilize the remaining time in most efficient way. After following this plan properly, students can score more than 90% marks. Even if you have not prepared for the CBSE board exams so far, you should not worry. This is the right time to start your preparation so you can start your preparation right now by following the study plan given below. It is expected that you have studied all the chapters mentioned in latest CBSE Syllabus 2017 – 2018. For revision purpose, you can also take help of study material prepared by experts at Moducation from the links given below Monthly Study Plan to score 90% in CBSE 10th and 12th Board Exams 2018: What to Study in December During Pre Board Exams: December is the time for pre board examinations in most of the CBSE schools. Sometimes, CBSE 10th and 12th students do not prepare for pre-board exams seriously because the marks obtained in pre boards are not added to the final board marks. However, these pre-board exams are very important and must be attempted seriously with an honest effort because Pre-board exams provide real time scenario similar to the CBSE board exams. From these exams, students can easily identify their weaknesses and information about what they need to study. Moducation faculty advise all students to go through Class 10/12 Marking Scheme and CBSE toppers answer sheets (released by CBSE) before appearing in Pre - Board Examinations. Answer Sheet of CBSE Class 12 Toppers Answer Sheet of CBSE Class 10 Toppers Marking Scheme for CBSE Class 10 Board Exam 2018 Marking Scheme for CBSE Class 12 Marking Scheme 2018 How to Prepare for Boards in January 2018 Once CBSE Board Exam 2018 Date Sheet will be released? CBSE 10th & 12th board exam 2018 Date Sheet is expected to be released in the first week of January. Students preparing for CBSE board exam must plan (re-plan) their study accordingly immediately after the release of the Date Sheet for board exams. It is expected that every students must have studied the complete Syllabus, by the end of December. CBSE has also issued sample papers (like every year) to help students in understanding the latest examination pattern. During January, students must solve CBSE sample papers based on the latest board exam pattern and marking scheme. It is very difficult to score well without solving CBSE 12th and 10th practice papers. During this month students advised to revise formulae and concepts (or short notes) for every chapter and then solve chapterwise questions from previous year CBSE Board Papers. Solving previous year CBSE question papers of last 10 years is the key to score above 90% in CBSE board examinations because questions based on the concepts given in previous year CBSE question papers are repeated frequently in CBSE Class 10 or 12 board exams. Very frequently questions are repeated from previous year papers. Students can also attempt few CBSE Guess papers specially prepared for students who are going to appear for CBSE 10th and 12th board exam 2018. Sample Paper for CBSE Class 10 Exam 2018 Sample Paper for CBSE Class 12 Exam 2018 CBSE Class 10 Guess Papers CBSE Class 12 Guess Papers How to Study in February, the Last Month Before Final Board Exam 2018: (Revise & Practice: Don’t study anything new) One should devote this month for revision purpose only. Do not study anything new in this month as you may get stuck in any new topic during last moment and it may add more confusion and may also result in wastage of precious time. Students should revise NCERT textbook summery, Formulae and Concepts in Moducation App & hand written notes prepared by themselves. Try solving at least 2 papers on daily basis. Stop using Facebook, Twitter and other social media websites. Usually students get involved in unnecessary conversations and discussions on these social sites which leads to emotional stress and hence wastage of time. So, be honest to yourself and uninstall all other apps not related to your board exams to follow your study timetable. What to Study in March During Board Exams : (Give your Best in CBSE Board Exams 2018) NO new chapter should be prepared during board exam period. During board examinations students do not have enough time to study entire syllabus in details. Therefore, they should focus only on the important highlighted concepts and summery of all chapters. Students can use self made notes (which they might have prepared while studying) and the important concepts and Formulae prepared by Moducation Experts. They should also solve CBSE guess papers because guess papers include important questions for CBSE board examination and such questions are asked in board exams. Modulation experts advise you not to read each and every line of NCERT at this stage because it is not possible now. more information visit edulekha

Its so simple…. To be honest, I just got 88.6% for my class 10 boards while I was expecting a 90%+. I wonder how I lost all my marks in sst. I expected a 90+ for SST but ended up getting 81. I gave for verification of marks expecting a raise. Anyway, coming back to the point, how to score 90%+ in boards. As I said it's just simple, you just need to devote extra time for studies and voila it's that simple. I didn't go for any tuition or any other alternate classes but still kinda got this much by just brushing up through NCERT text prior to the examinations. If a normal student like me can score this much then why can't anyone else?? So that's all buddy, what I just want to say is study to face the challenges which come as examinations in our life. Don't see Examinations as a burden nor see it as a piece of shit. Just move on and on to reach higher levels by competing yourself. The higher levels you reach, the more are the chances to achieve your goal.

The points which I am going to tell you can help you to get your dream percentage and I have used it to get 95 percent… For physics blindly read line by line s-chand books. And solve only hots question..you don't need any turion to read s Chand books because they are very student friendly..if you read it like story then you can complete NCERT just by seeing it..For maths stick on NCERT miscellaneous and Rd Sharma solved examples that is sufficient.In social science just go through the lectures of school and underline the important points said by your teacher and when teacher explaining something write it in point form on the book so that while going through the book it is very easy for you to get the point very clear..In geography make everything in chartform so that it is very easy for you to retain the stats in it ..When in exam you don't understand what exactly the question is asking write everything thing about the event that you know in pts you will get 1/2or1/4 marks..Enjoy this class and don't make study. Do follow your passion ..so that atlast you don't regret of class 10 because after class the syllabus increases drastically and a lot of burden suddenly comes to you..ADVICE - be positive and stay well♥️Please upvote and motivate me 💪

Thanks for A2A, Getting 10 CGPA in class 1oth is quite easy, there were 16 students out of class of 33 students in my tenth that scored 10 CGPA. There are few important steps that could be taken religiously to score 10 CGPA:- 1.Rely greatly over your NCERT: It’s may sound hollow to a few but it works wonders, NCERT is the best book for understanding deeper into the subject, give it a try. 2. Have a thorough understanding: Chapters are not about only reading but having a deeper look into it. It is sad but its true that students rote learns subjects, where its clear that at this point understanding is important 3. Read chapters 3–4 times: Now this point might upset most of the students, they think that if they read there NCERT again and again how would they move on further, well you might not understand this thing but it really comes handy, there are many questions that are asked directly through a given paragraph and the point is they don’t even change its language and by just reading you may remember the whole para 4. Practice as much as you can: “Practice makes a man perfect” is not only a proverb but also true in our practical lives, practice sample papers as much as you can and try relying on previous years board question papers and ulike. That’s all, but follow this steps religiously Good Luck For Your Exam

see as per the current scenario, CBSE has opted for the full syllabus exams from class 10th onwards, earlier it was only for class 12th. so it becomes a little difficult for the students but its not a matter to worry if you are consistent with your studies especially in subjects like social science where you need to learn 4 subjects which generally becomes difficult for the students to remember till the end also many leave the mapwork and hence it degrades the percentage hence i would suggest that please be consistent with social at least. in English you need to improve your writing skills and try to avoid spelling mistakes, also you can watch a summary on youtube, there are plenty of them available in English as well as Hindi ( if you know ). they help you with the summary which is very useful at the end, coming up with the novel its not that difficult to write even if you had read the novel once or even preparing the character sketches would be sufficient. maths and science are the subjects you need to understand also regular question practice in maths will have no problem at all, same with science, pls don't leave any diagram from the ncert, be it physics, chemistry or biology, diagram related questions are always asked . hope it helps.

The most important aspect to score more than 90% in 10 CBSE is hardwork and regularity. If you follow a regular routine in a disciplined way , it is very easy to score 90+% Just one little thing you need to do is study everyday. And study that part which has been taught in the class and tution the same day. This will help you feel like you are just revising not studying so you won’t feel a pressure. And yes one more thing..make notes , this is the key aspect. And at last when everyone will do hardwork you will do smartwork by just studying your notes which you made all round the year. Hope this helps you!:)

Whatever I am going to tell , I will tell it with heart . It is not much difficult to score above 90 or 95 in board exam . I have heard people saying that I have scored above 95 by studing only 3 weeks before the exam . I did not believe it . It required a regular practise from starting . You should start practising from starting of the session . You should clear all of your doubts and solve last 15 years paper. They will be really fruitful. Just study with with full focus and concentration . Just follow these guidelines they will be enough .

Study Hard. There is no shortcut or trick to score above 99. Hard work and dedication is all it takes. Start the preparation from the beginning itself. Make a schedule/time table for yourself and study according to that. Make sure you go with the flow of studies. Study according to your syllabus and exam pattern. Go through the NCERT books thoroughly. After you are done with that, opt for Oswaal Books Question Banks. They are detailed in nature. It contains Chapterwise and Topicwise presentation for systematic and methodical study. Practice previous years question papers. It will help you boost up your confidence. You will get to know the question pattern and also where you are lacking and what are your weaknesses. Never try and sit with one subject for the entire day. Mix-match that is, pick two subjects for a day and work on every subject with divided time. This reduces the boredom as well as enables you to finish the portion simultaneously with all subjects, in a planned way. Always write and learn. By this, you will not forget things easily. Plus, do not mug up anything rather than understand the concept. Just focus and study smart. Have a positive attitude and believe in yourself. All the best!

For Social Studies: Focus on NCERT. Go through relevant chapters and write answers in points. For Maths: Study RD Sharma atleast once followed by previous year papers (available on Meritnation) or Mock papers. For Science : Study NCERT (Classification of Animal kingdom by notes) .Learn some examples of Reactions. You can refer Togetherwith for Previous year questions. For Hindi: Go through each and every chapter of NCERT. English: Try to use bookish words in answers and read Letters /Articles every week. Hope that helps.. CHEERS.

For Hindi ncert is sufficient For English Golden guide is best Hope it helps and Best of luck for boards Pls do vote

For scoring 90+ percentage in class 10 Firstly you need to clear ur concepts like whatever u study on ur tution or in ur school u should revise it daily by routine and do questions regarding that topic and secondly don't focus on reference book and all just focus on ur NCERT And in place of buying refrence book u just go for some sample paper just purchase xm idea sample paper for ur subjects as it is available in market for year2018–19 and if u had completed any chapter from ur textbook then just do questions from that book bcoz it contain 2 marker,3 markwr and 5 marker questions from examination point of view. And don't worry it's not that difficult to score 90% just be sincere with ur study and be dedicated becoz dedication + ur hardwork +ur determination will lead ur path towards ur sucess and be away from distractions just focus on ur studies as it's not that difficult . Hope.. it will help u.

It depends on your preparation strategies.. 2 months are left..Start your revision of all the subjects…Hindi,english ,social studies…these subjects are easy as compared to others..so complete these chapters first..solve sample papers,previous year question paper..as many as you can.. Then move to science…first complete biology…then chemistry and then physics..in this subject your concept must be crystal clear…examiners frame tricky question sometimes…you will get help from the previous year question paper of 3–4 years…many question are repeated…so solve them.. Moving on to mathematics…you just have to practice ,practice and practice.. Solve as much as sample papers and pre. Yr question paper… You have to devote your 2 months for these…so stay focused.. Best of luck

I have scored 90+ in my BOARDS so i guess i am a right person to answer this question . firstly , please follow regular studies and completeyour work. secondly, focus on your weak subjects from starting only and try not to gather more than 2 weak subjects because it will cause your marks only . never be over confident thinking i know everything in this or that subject because at the end it will cost you. lastly, revise and read and be expert in NCERT only yes only and only NCERT my papers were only and purely from NCERT so i guess u should follow ur textbooks only . MOST IMPORTANT PLEASE FOLLOW A DAILY ROUTINE AND HARD WORK DAILY AND ON REGULAR BASIS DO NOT THINK I WILL STUDY ONE MONTH BEFORE AND WILL CROSS 90’S AS MANY YOU TUBE VIDEOS SUGGEST . Be confident and careful . Best wishes for your exams and future endeavours.

I am not going to tell you to leave everything like tv , mobile , outing etc. like our parents say us. Scoring 90+ in 10th is not a big deal.One with dedication can easily score it .All u need is a good teacher and large amount of self study. MATHS. For maths first u should understand all concepts then go to ncert and then chapter wise solve examples of RD sharma . SCIENCE. NCERT IS BIBLE……. SST . READ NCERT ONLY .

Thats very simple …… Firstly be regular to classes as well as studies. Start study from first day. Make and follow time table. Timetable must include some activities of your choice which make you feel relax. Ex-Drawing ,singing, dancing etc. Don't be overconfident. For CBSE follow syallabus of NCERT. Read line to line and understand the concept. Relate topics with daily life examples. Have group discussion to better understand the topic and enhance your knowledge. Solve question papers when you are done . Revise and revise. Be regular to class till last moment. Be healthy.

Well Scoring 90% in CBSE Class 10th is Not that tough. Well you need to be punctual and focused about your GOALS. Study Every topic wisely, make proper notes, write down formulas. And most importantly practice previous year paper, solve numericals of different subjects. Be prepared both mentally and physically. Learn stress management and time management. Utilize most of your time and energy for Your Dream. Then easily you can get 90%+ in class 10th. Best of Luck.

Disclaimer: I had scored 96% in my class 10 CBSE board exams. Hence I might be able to offer some advise. The following points may sound cliched but might highlight some points that you might have missed: Study on a regular basis. It is not required to study 10 hours a day. Just a couple of hours of self study will be more than enoughFocus on getting the concepts right.Make a schedule and try to stick to it especially when the exams are a couple of months away.Go through past paper. Questions are often repeated. (Quite generalized)The guides available may help but do go through your NCERT textbooks properly. Make sure that you cover all important exercises.Also, I’m the co-founder of Learnest where we provide the option of enrolling for chapter specific courses. If you’re a grade 10th CBSE student, please do have a look. You’d get access to engaging videos, unlimited doubts solving and mock tests. Link - Learnest Sample Video:

By studying! There are no shortcuts for getting good marks. Start from the very beginning of your 10th..not just study, learn everything by heart… leaving anything for the end time is not an option here. If you don't understand just ask, ask 100 times until the concept is clear…3–4 hours a day is the perfect time for studying.. All the very best and do find time to enjoy this time of your life.

You can get 90% easily in 10th. Before exams- you have to make a strategy. Study according to the syllabus. Complete the syllabus atleast 15 days before the exams. So that you can get enough time to solve the previous year papers. Because a lot of questions are repeated from previous 10 years paper. 90% are really easy to score if you solve last 10 year papers.

Cbse boards are literally easy and their markings are also lenient.. Don't be afraid if u study in Feb before boards like me.. You too will score good marks... Just study daily what ur teachers have taught.. Read science ncert thoroughly and do maths ncert as well.. But remember u may get unexpected marks in some subjects.. Like I was expecting 78 marks in Hindi but I got 71 marks.. And also it depends on schools how much they send marks of urs out of 20 per subject.. Best of luck for ur future

Do the NCERT properly. After completing the syllabus solve Oswaal sample papers and previous year papers. This will be more than enough to score 90+ in the board exam. Some other tips are:- 1. Make notes. 2.Revise daily 3. Read your textbox properly 4.Practice chapter wise question paper 5.Have proper sleep and exercise 6. Make sure to use your time in an effective manner and don’t end up wasting it. You have enough time to work on your goals. Be consistent and work hard. And don’t stress much and just chill. Hope this helps :)

Look at your ncert books with utmost respect. Think your NCERT textbooks as your Bible, Quran and Geeta. Read them as much as you can and try to focus on what is taught in your school and self-study rather than running after coaching and tuitions. I guess self-study will help you more. Make quick notes and practice questions for mathematics as much as you can from different books but only after completing your ncert yourself. This will surely help you and when you have doubts then go to your respective teachers and get them cleared! All the best :)

To score well in 10th boards is not so tough thing to do. You only have to concentrate on your studies. M-learning is the best way to study online, watch it's videos on YouTube you could find each and every topic of your syllabus on it and also explained very well manner. You could find videos of different subjects in a well sorted manner.

I had scored 10 cgpa in class 10 , just by strictly following the NCERT book. In exam questions are asked both from the chapter exercise and also from inside the chapter. So read the book carefully and mark each and every important point. Most important: learn those things which are given in box in every chapter. For further any queries follow me on Quora and ask what you want to know.

For any subjects, “Pomodoro Technique” is the best technique for studying. If you follow this technique , your interest will grow in any related subject.This technique helps you to remember the answers for long time.
